docs.lead_paragraph: It is too late for this Christmas, but here is a gift that will serve just as well next year, or the next decade or the next century, which isn't so far away as all that. It is a new set of books called Sports Classics, published by Holtzman Press Inc. of Evanston, Ill.

docs.lead_paragraph: On the day the World Series moved from Boston to Cincinnati, a man named Charles August Risberg died in a convalescent home in Red Bluff, Calif. Death came on his 81st birthday, exactly 56 years and four days after the Cincinnati Reds won a World Series for the first time. Swede Risberg helped them win it.

docs.lead_paragraph: Joe Garagiola and Red Barber, never harmonious when colleagues on the New York Yankees' broadcasting crew, will not have a reunion on television next Tuesday as originally planned by the National Broadcasting Company.

docs.lead_paragraph: Red Auerbach, who built the Boston Celtics into one of the greatest dynasties in sports, presiding over 16 National Basketball Association championship teams as a coach, general manager and club president, died Saturday in Washington. He was 89. His death was announced by the Celtics. The cause was a heart attack, The Associated Press reported.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Cubs’ president of baseball operations won the day over the Red Sox, which he led as general manager for nearly a decade. The Cubs hired Epstein, who is originally from Boston, in October.

docs.lead_paragraph: In the doubleheader’s first game, A. J. Burnett turned in an amazing performance in the Yankees’ victory ; the Red Sox needed 14 innings to extract a win in Game 2.
docs.abstract: New York Yankees and Boston Red Sox split doubleheader, with Yankees winning first game, 6-2, and Red Sox taking second, 7-4, in 14 innings; Yankees have secured AL division title and home-field advantage through playoffs, while Red Sox are fighting to hang on to wild-card spot.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Yankees inched closer to a wild-card berth, but only because of losses by the Twins and the Angels. After a bullpen collapse, the Yankees must wait at least another day to clinch.
docs.abstract: Boston Red Sox defeat New York Yankees, 9-5, in 11 innings.

docs.lead_paragraph: For the second straight game, Pedro Ciriaco delivered a late hit to propel the Red Sox over the Yankees, this time with a bloop single in the 10th inning against reliever Dave Robertson.
docs.abstract: Boston Red Sox take ten innings to defeat the New York Yankees, 3-2.
